meanings.definition: A group of animals or plants with similar characteristics that can produce offspring
meanings.sent1: The labrador retriever is a popular breed of dog.
meanings.sent2: The farmer raises different breeds of chickens on his farm.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper joked that the penguins were a mischievous breed.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, the designer's unique breed of creativity stood out.
meanings.sent5: The scientist studied the genetic makeup of each breed to understand their differences.

meanings.sent1: The horses will breed in the spring season.
meanings.sent2: The birds breed in their natural habitats.
meanings.sent3: The flowers seemed to breed overnight in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Creativity and innovation breed success in the business world.
meanings.sent5: Hard work and dedication can breed positive results in any endeavor.

meanings.definition: A particular type or kind of animal or plant
meanings.sent1: The rose is a beautiful breed of flower.
meanings.sent2: The Siamese cat is a popular breed among pet owners.
meanings.sent3: The chef experimented with a new breed of spices in the recipe.
meanings.sent4: The rare breed of orchid only blooms once a year.
meanings.sent5: The farmer takes pride in his unique breed of sheep.

meanings.definition: To cause something to happen or develop
meanings.sent1: Positive thinking can breed optimism in difficult situations.
meanings.sent2: Education can breed knowledge and understanding.
meanings.sent3: The rainy weather seemed to breed a sense of coziness indoors.
meanings.sent4: Confidence can breed success in various aspects of life.
meanings.sent5: Kindness and compassion can breed positivity in relationships.
